Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX Mortgage XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NJ XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I have been trying to resolve this matter for over a year. XXXX XXXX asked me to help reconcile his account and I sent an email to customer care on XX/XX/XXXX. The email I received stated that he needed to give written authorization, which he did on XX/XX/XXXX. He died on XX/XX/XXXX. No one ever got back to me. I was told that I needed letters testamentary to get any information regarding the account. 
The probate process is long, and I received letters on XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted them again on XX/XX/XXXX. Their response on XX/XX/XXXX stated that my information would be forwarded to the appropriate department for review and processing. It never stated they had filed for foreclosure. I sent another email on XX/XX/XXXX requesting information because I had not heard from the company, and I learned that the property was being foreclosed on even though it was still in probate. 
They never properly informed me on this matter. No timely information was sent to resolve the matter before it was sent to foreclosure. In doing my research a letter was sent to me and the deceased at his property address on XX/XX/XXXX giving him 30 days to dispute. However, 2 days later a foreclosure in XXXX XXXX was filed on XX/XX/XXXX even though they knew the property was in probate. Then a duplicate letter was sent to me at the deceased address on XX/XX/XXXX. This seemed like a bad faith attempt. All letters addressed to me should have been sent to my address. When I contacted them on XX/XX/XXXX this was within the XXXXday period of the XX/XX/XXXX letter, so a foreclosure should not have been filed. Their responses to me should have included the fact that they prematurely filed for foreclosure, so I do not feel that those fees are warranted. I asked for a waiver of the fees, and I never received a response to my request. The account was reinstated and I still have not received notice of cancellation of the foreclosure. 
I received the XXXX statement with assessed expenses of {$2400.00} and no explanation. When I called, I was told to look at the transaction part which had an assessed expense of {$100.00} for attorneys fees on XX/XX/XXXX but no other explanation. Customer service told me that they sent a reply to my waiver request to an XXXX XXXX XXXX instead of my office address or even the property address. 
It is unfortunate that no one is taking accountability for the multiple mistakes made in reconciliation of this account. No one seems to have any authority to give me requested information and correspondence is continually being sent to the wrong place even though my information has been given to you multiple times. Extra fees are still being added to the account.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I started my house buying process with XXXX XXXX at XXXX my original interest rate was 3.99 %. and locked in until XX/XX/XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX my interest rate changed to 4.625. % and locked in until XX/XX/XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX it remained at 4.625 % and locked until XX/XX/XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX it remained at 4.525 % On XX/XX/XXXX it changed to 5.25 % and locked until XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX it remained 5.25 % My loan amount was for XXXX. 
I brought this issue to the mortgage lender attention he stated on XX/XX/XXXX that he had already requested XXXX extension and they cost money. He also stated due to difficulty with the appraisal that he forgot to lock in my rate and he was unable to do anything. I asked him to educate about me this process. He stated typically it takes XXXX days to close and since mines took over 30 days. He stated this led to the increase. The process was extended due to an low appraisal value and the appraisal company XXXX XXXX failure to respond in a timely manner. A request for review was made XX/XX/XXXX and an updated report was not provided until XX/XX/XXXX. 

This the email I sent to upper management XXXX XXXX of the mortgage company on XX/XX/XXXX regarding the interest rack increase and the difficulty with the appraisal company. 

XXXX XXXX, XXXX at XXXX PM XXXX I am currently working with XXXX XXXX to close on my first home tomorrow. However, initially I was informed that my rate would be locked at 3.99 % ( XXXX and was due to expire on XXXX days ) during this period the appraisal was received on XX/XX/XXXX at {$160000.00}. A request for an accurate comparable to be made was requested the next day and the request was not updated or acknowledged until XXXX. Once corrected the value was assessed at {$180000.00}. I was informed by XXXX that he requested an extension however I see on XX/XX/XXXX the rate was increased to 4.6 % and expired on XX/XX/XXXX. However, on XX/XX/XXXX an extension was requested for the rate of 4.6 % which expired XX/XX/XXXX. The repairs requested from the appraisal were not completed until XX/XX/XXXX. Then on XX/XX/XXXX an extension was requested for 4.6 % which expired XX/XX/XXXX. At this time a reinspection was requested for the completed repairs. On XX/XX/XXXX another rate increased occured which is 5.35 % and brought my monthly payment to {$1400.00}. Initially my estimated monthly payment was roughly {$1300.00} with a 4.6 %. It appears that the lock initially was for only 14 days and it was not extended although the appraisal was not ordered until XX/XX/XXXX and the report was not received until XX/XX/XXXX. The delay from appraisal occured and the correct report was not received until XXXX which at this time no rate was locked in due date lock expiring. A new rate was not locked in until XX/XX/XXXX. Initially mortgage XXXX was handling my paperwork well, but somehow between the miscommunication associated with the appraisal agency ( that is unprofessional and unethical ) and now this rate gouge has occurred has made this a stressful experience. 

I remained in contact with XXXX via text and phone from XXXX until I received the updated appraisal. I also requested a new appraisal free of cost because the XXXX appeared to be biased. I was informed that was not possible. 

No resolution was ever reached. 
The loan was sold to XXXX

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I was the victim of a job scam. I accepted the job and was told that I would start later that month and that I need to complete a written assessment. After I completed the assessment I was told that I would need to order office supplies, so they emailed me a check for {$4300.00} and told me to deposit it in my own account and to send them a receipt. My bank USAA accepted the check immediately and did not mark it as fraud. After depositing this check, the job scammers told me the following day they to wire nearly all funds to an account to pay for equipment. This was on XX/XX/2023. Then the following morning after I wired the money, they send me another check to deposit and said that the money sent previously was not enough for all my office equipment. I told them I cant deposit and send another check because I have a daily limit. I cut off all contact with XXXX XXXX after that and informed my bank. My bank did not help me until I called a third time and asked them to stop the check and the wire transfer. They stopped the check but blamed me for the job scam and refuse to assist me further. I was told my bank account was locked every time and under investigation since I reported the scam. USAA let me know that the wire transfer was stopped and that the check was stopped. I was told it would take XXXX calendar days, then up to XXXX business days before my account would be unlocked. I called USAA XXXX times a week for XXXX weeks until I was transferred to the fraud department who told me that my account was not locked, and that they did not stop the wire transfer because they believed it was my fault for being scammed and that I had to pay the $ XXXX due to the check being fraudulent. They did not say they knew it was fraudulent. I reported it as fraud which is why they stopped the check. They refuse to help me any further so I had to file a police report and contact the bank where the wire transfer was sent to by myself .l. After weeks of getting the run around and heading that everything was being investigated, I was rudely told by the fraud department that this was all my fault and that I needed to pay up. They also made it a point to bring up the fact that I previously disputed a charge from an app ca. Instead of helping me in a difficult time where I had to find someway to pay my rent since I was made to believe my account was locked and that they were helping me resolve this.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Can't close your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern : US bank placed a hard hold on my joint checking bank account on XX/XX/2023 and subsequently informed me that they will be closing the bank account. Routing Number : XXXX. Bank Account number : XXXX. Account holders XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX, ( married ). 

I am writing this letter because US Bank is refusing to return to me my account balance of {$9400.00}. US Bank told me that I am not allowed to withdraw the funds at the local branch if I visit them. Instead, US Bank first told me that they will mail me a check for the balance on my checking account after 7-10 business days, which means I may not receive a check via mail for 2 weeks. Next, US Bank told me that they have the right to hold my bank account balance for 90 days while they review my bank account. 

Despite visiting the local US Bank Branch in XXXX, CA on XXXX XXXX, and making numerous phone calls to the US Bank fraud department, the US Bank bankruptcy department as well as the US Bank fraud liaison department, I was told again and again that nothing can be done to assist me further, and that they could not explain why they had chosen to close my account and hold on to my funds. I am in XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy and my attorney also sent them two letters telling them that it was illegal for them to place holds the funds in my bank accounts, to which they said they would lift all the holds, but a hold on my bank account balance remains in place as of this date. 

The hold on the funds in my bank account is creating an immediate, severe economic hardship for me and my husband. The bank 's actions have resulted in reversing my mortgage payment, reversing my XXXX XXXX XXXX utility payments ( resulting in my power being cut off ), and leaving me without any cash in my pocket for reasonable living expenses ( like food! ). I have also accumulated numerous late fees and bank return fees as a result of US Banks actions. My mortgage payment, my XXXX  XXXX payment as well as my electric payment have been returned and I have been charged additional late fees and bank return fees. 

Moreover, I am shocked by US Banks lack of customer service, downright meanness, inhumane and probably illegal behavior. It seems that US bank does not care if their actions put people on the street. 

Please force US Bank to return me the balance of my bank account funds immediately! 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX refunded me in full for my stay on XXXX  - XX/XX/ for {$380.00} on XXXXXXXXz There has been no information as to why I was charged again on XXXX. Ive spoken to several employees as well as sending an email to the manager asking for clarification. No one had gotten back to me. 

I opened a dispute with Wells Fargo on XX/XX/. I forwarded the email from the hotel stating I would be refunded. Wells Fargo said they will credit me the charge on XX/XX/. I reviewed my account and the charge was not credited. I called again on XXXX  the dispute rep said she saw all of the information there and would process the credit. To date the credit has not happened. I called on XX/XX/XXXX  and the dispute rep now tells me they have to close the old dispute and create a new one. 
I need this resolved and the interest rates from the fraudulent charged credited back to my account. 

Please advise on next steps.

Consumer complaint narrative: Checking account opened XX/XX/XXXX. I am a previous customer of BMO Harris ( last account closed XX/XX/XXXX ) and have existing login credentials. I attempted to log into my new account on XX/XX/XXXX using my existing login credentials and kept getting a message that my credentials weren't matching what they had on file. I called and spoke with CSR XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX advised that I couldn't access my online account because my initial deposit hadn't yet hit the account, and to give it a couple days ; once my account was funded, I'd be able to access it. When I was still unable to access it on XX/XX/XXXX, I called again and spoke with CSR XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. He looked into it and couldn't determine what the problem was ; he said he would open a ticket with their tech department and he would call me back in 2-3 business days to let me know the status. I never heard from him again. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called again, this time requesting to speak to a manager. I was transferred to, and spoke with, XXXX XXXX ( her phone number is XXXX ). She also could not determine what the problem was in my accessing the account ; she said she would submit an expedited request with the tech team and she assured me that she would call me back by the end of that day. I never heard from her again. I left voice mail messages for XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX and never received a return call. As of this morning, I still can not access my online account, although two deposits have been made ( one of which is a payroll direct deposit ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/2023 I opened an account with Wells Fargo reacting to the marketing offer. Starting in XXXX I have worked in the XXXX and to that effect I requested the bank to send me a paper bill to the XXXX address. The bill never arrived. 
Furthermore the bank apparently mispelled my US address therefore despite speaking with three people at the bank 's customer service I was given no assistance regarding the exact start of the account. 
The issue is that the marketing offer extended relates to spend of {$3000.00} within the 90 days of the account opening. Since the bank blocked my online access as I am using my device overseas ( foreign IP address ) as threat it also refused to provide me with the account opening date. I think this is done on purpose so the 90 days threshold is not met and this info is absolutely no way related to the account security. Furthermore the WF staff is utterly rude and unprofessional and instead of providing the solution to the problem such as this they just offer meaningless and ridiculous talking points which have absolutely no relation to reality

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to bring to your attention a significant issue I have been facing with two mortgage servicing companies, XXXX XXXX XXXX and Shellpoint Mortgage Services, which has had severe financial consequences for myself and my family. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sold my house, and all outstanding balances were paid off to Caliber Home Loans at the closing. However, during the same period, XXXX XXXX XXXX was in the process of transferring my mortgage to Shellpoint Mortgage Services. After the closing, I discovered that Shellpoint Mortgage Services was erroneously reporting that my mortgage had not been paid off and listed it as delinquent on my credit report. 

Despite my attempts to provide proof of the mortgage 's closure and the payment made to XXXX XXXX XXXX, I have been unable to rectify this situation with either company. As a result of this error by XXXX and Shellpoint, my ability to qualify for a mortgage or obtain any form of credit has been severely impacted, causing immense financial burdens and instability for myself and my family. 

I have diligently communicated with both companies and the credit bureaus to resolve this matter, but the situation remains unresolved. I am at a loss as to how to proceed further, and this ongoing issue is causing me significant emotional distress. As of today, Thursday XX/XX/XXXX, my credit report shows that I am 120+ days delinquent on a mortgage that no longer exists.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was just awarded my home in a recent divorce. I had to refinance in my own name to be able to obtain a mortgage. I was notified by email from the lender that there is a judgment/lien on the property. I called the county clerk 's office who notified me that there was a judgment. I then contacted the court where the judgment was made and they subsequently told me the nature of the claim, I discovered that this debt belonged to my son for unpaid car payments and repossession. 
They had his address listed and his identifying information but they put a lien on my residence because he shares the same name as my ex-husband. I explained all of this to the collector XXXX, who said that it happens all the time but they were not going to do anything to rectify the situation. My son and ex-husband have different birthdays, social security numbers, and middle initials. They even had my son 's address listed on the court documents. They were fully aware that these were not the same people. My son was XXXX years old when we bought the house. 
The judgment was entered on XX/XX/2023 in the amount of {$3800.00}. The business is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The debt collector is Lacy Katzen LLP. I spoke with the collector this afternoon on XX/XX/2023.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2023 : Fraud alert placed on my credit card. 
Called the number listed and was asked to verify my phone number and secret word on the account. Both were matched. 
Then I was told my cell phone number could not be used to send out a code to verify my identity. 
I was then asked a barrage of personal questions, such as my maiden name, my mother 's maiden name, what other Citi accounts I have. 
They then asked me for another phone number or another person 's phone number to send a code to. I don't have another phone number and did not provide another person 's number to them. 
None of my answers worked, and none of that information was included in my application, so how would that be used to verify me? This in itself seems fraudulent. Where is that information being check against, and where is it now stored? 
Finally I was told I would have to wait for 5 to 10 days to receive a letter in the mail with a code and instructions to unlock my card. 
XX/XX/2023 : Made another call to see if I could get this resolved. The exact same process began again. Once she told me she could not send the text message, and started to ask for other personal information, I told her I was done with the call. 
I have since done an online search and found that there are hundreds of people going through this and it has been happening for a very long time. 
This is an unethical practice and in no way in the best interest of me and others as the customer.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
Citibank is in severe violation of the FCRA by failing as a furnisher to provide reasonable investigation, and committing unfair and deceptive practices ( UDAAP ) by failing to acknowledge they are participating in attempted identity theft. On XX/XX/2023, I received a credit reporting alert of a new credit inquiry. XXXX reported a credit inquiry that same day from Citibank NA., Best Buy. I immediately called Citibank at XXXX to dispute this credit reporting because I did not request an extension of credit or authorize the use of my information in any manner. I have excellent credit and was fearful the credit was open, but Citi confirmed it was denied. Citi never provided me a reason for denying the extension of credit, but during this call I was grateful Citi did not find it appropriate to approve the request. That same day I initiated a lock on my credit with all three credit reporting bureaus to prevent future attempts of fraud. 

On XXXX Citi called to verify my mailing address so they could send their final investigation results. A few days later I received Citi 's denial to remove the hard credit inquiry. Citi justified maintaining the reporting because all of my correct personal information was used to initiate the credit request. Because my personal information was fully used to make a credit inquiry, open an account, etc., does not negate fraudulent activity. I am disappointed by Citi 's failure to acknowledge attempted identity theft and the attempt to open an account with their financial institution using my personal information. Citi clearly found reasonable justification to deny the fraudulent attempt to open the credit account, but fails identity theft victims by refusing to remove incorrect credit reporting information.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Delay in processing application
Consumer complaint narrative:
I signed up for a Costco Membership as well as a Costco Anywhere Visa Card by Citi. I registered my account but was initially unable to log in. After troubleshooting on my own for a week, I called Citi Bank and was told it was an authentication error on their side. The customer service representative I spoke to said that they reset my account and that after 24 hours I should be able to register again and then log in.

After waiting 24 hours, I was unable to reset my card. During the following weeks, I would continuously contact Citi Bank customer service and request assistance with this issue. For most of these conversations, I was told that a ticket was opened under my account to address the issue and that it should be fixed. Every time I contacted Citi Bank, I was advised to wait and try again after a certain amount of time. The second to last time I contacted them, I was told to wait a little over a week, and that I would receive an email confirmation that the ticket was resolved. 

During this time I also tried to pay off my credit card statement over the phone, and I was initially told that I was unable to do so because they were unable to find the routing number of the credit union I use. This was eventually corrected on a different call, but was still troubling. 

However, the registration issue persisted. On XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX XXXX several weeks after I first reported the issue and reached out to Citi Bank customer service, I was able to speak to a supervisor. Her name was XXXX, and she informed me that there was in fact no ticket associated with my account and that the only way to proceed was waiting 7 days to confirm my identity. At this point, my statement was due in 7 days, and she told me that I had no other options and that there was nothing that Citi Bank could do. 

This completely went against the previous information that Citi Bank had told me. The customer service that I've experienced has been the most unprofessional and unreliable I have ever experienced. Between the misinformation and miscommunication, I feel that this is a completely unreliable credit card service provider. I have spent close to 8 hours on the phone with Citi Bank customer service, and no solutions were found during this. This was not something that I did wrong, which the representatives I spoke to confirmed. This was an issue caused by Citi Bank, that they did not resolve, despite telling me it would soon be fixed. It should not take over a month and several frustrating phone calls to simply register for an account. 

I was also notified that there may be fraudulent activity on my account, but I have no way to confirm this. Even over the phone, I was told nothing. To me, this is completely unacceptable.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The list of accounts below have violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

I told XXXX, Transunion, and XXXX to investigate these accounts : XXXX XXXX {$13.00}, XXXX ; XXXX XXXX  {$3400.00} ; XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$1000.00} ; XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$500.00} ; XXXX XXXX  {$500.00} ; XXXX XXXX {$3600.00} ; XXXX XXXX {$1400.00} ; XXXX XXXX {$810.00} ; XXXX XXXX XXXX {$520.00} ; XXXX XXXX  {$540.00} ; However they stated everything was complete and accurate. But how is that possible if the open date, date of last activity, and much more is incorrect. According to 15 USC 1681 i ( 5 ) they are supposed to modify the accounts that arent reporting correctly.

15 USC 1681 section 602A states I have the right to privacy.

15 USC 1681 section 604A section 2 also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

15 USC 1681 c. ( a ) ( 5 ) states no consumer reporting agency may make any customer containing any of the following any adverse item information ; other than records of convictions of crimes for 7 years.

Then the application was allegedly denied but then I was told that information was incorrect and that the application was still under review. During this time, my credit was being adversely affected. When I initially inquired about this, I was told that it was at the lenders ' discretion to report the late payments- which didn't make much sense since I was obviously in dire need of mortgage assistance. However, after speaking with the Loss Mitigation Department, I was advised that the adverse reporting would be reversed once the application was approved. It has now been approved and in light of this unsatisfactory application process that prompted a XXXX complaint, I am requesting for the negative reporting to be removed from my credit profile.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I tried to buy XXXX XXXX tickets. The Seller was charging {$350.00} per ticket and I was planning to buy 3 tickets so a total of {$1000.00}. The Seller requested payment through XXXX. Prior to sending the money, I called US Bank to ask if I was covered by my bank in case this ended up being a scam. I did my due diligence by looking into the person and asking specific questions and felt like it was legit. The customer service rep at US Bank told me that I would be covered if it was a scam and all I needed to do was to call back and dispute the charge on my checking account and a claim would be opened. Unfortunately, it ended up being a scam so I called US Bank and immediately disputed the charge and opened the claim. I was told that is would take 7-10 business days to hear a decision and if it was approved then it could take 45 days to get the money back. I asked what the likelihood of this being approved given the situation and was told it was very likely as I was clearly scammed. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from US Bank telling me my claim was denied. On this letter there was no reason for denial and it says I can call US Bank and request an documents used in the investigation. I called US Bank and asked what was going on, the rep pulled up the claim and could not find any reason on her end or any documents used. The rep told me that she would reach out the claims rep and when she heard back she would call me. She never called me back. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called US Bank again to see what is going on with this claim. That rep asked if the letter gave a reason for the denial and I said no. They put me on hold to find out what was going on. When they returned all they said was it was denied and I could call the police and file a civil suit if I wanted to. When I asked, why I was told otherwise back on XX/XX/XXXX, I was not given an answer. I requested all of the documents that were used in the investigation to be mailed to me. I was lied to on multiple occasions by US Bank and how they handle this situation makes it hard to trust them. Their employees agree with me and understood my frustration and thought it was not fair as I was told on the phone.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Issue: Problem with the payoff process at the end of the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/2023, I took out a cash advance of {$750.00} from Truist Bank through the mobile app. I tried to pay off the loan and close my accounts on XX/XX/2023, resulting in Complaint # XXXX, where they refused to close my account. The reason the account wasn't closed was they were continuing to try to take a recurring payment for a credit card account that I had also closed the the same day. At the teller window, I told them about the line of credit and asked that it be paid off and closed at the same time. They did not have access to see the line of credit, and so when I stressed that I wanted to make sure it was paid off, they assured me all my debts were paid. 

Because the line of credit was not accessible to the teller, the line was not paid off, and the interest and fees continued to accrue. In addition, they tied the line of credit to my checking account and on XX/XX/2023, they reported both the line of credit and the checking account it was tied to as delinquent to the credit bureaus. I called the customer service lines and visited the branch and it wasn't until this week, XX/XX/XXXX, that the credit line debt was revealed. I am appalled that a bank could lend money and XXXX. ) Not allow someone to pay that money back at a bank location XXXX. ) Not keep a ledger or any records accessible on the app, by Customer Service, or by the branch employees, and XXXX. ) Not tell me about the debt until it was reported to the credit bureaus, and XXXX. ) Tie the debt to my checking account so that XXXX accounts were reported delinquent instead of just the line of credit. Moreover, I tried to close accounts, was denied the ability to close the accounts, reported the issue to this bureau and should have discovered then that there was an issue then, and not XXXX months later. 

I have since paid this off and I am now seeking to have this negative mark removed from my credit record. Having XXXX delinquent accounts has prevented me from getting a loan and has negatively affected my credit rating for XXXX months. Moreover, there was no transparency in this process and no one on the corporate side or the physical branch could or would help me until I planted myself in the branch office and refused to leave until they called corporate and figured out what the issue was. Even then, it took multiple visits to the branch and multiple phones from me and the banker to even figure out what the issue was. 

I am physically and mentally exhausted from this experience and appalled at the lack of transparency and complete lack of responsibility. I have been asked to provide cards and bank statements from accounts I thought I had closed, and repeated told to read my service agreements if I had an issue with my lack of responsibility in paying this. Banks should be required to keep records of their transactions and equip their employees to handled issues by providing access to their records.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Refer to CFPB complaint XXXX for background with my issues with USAA. 

As a result of their admission of fault in the result of cancelling my accounts without merit, I discovered they reported an open credit card account for the month of XXXX. 

Referring to the response from USAA on CFPB complaint XXXX : " XXXX XXXX, XXXX staff facilitated a re-review of the decision to discontinue doing business with you. It was determined that the decision was made in error, and steps were taken to reverse the actions taken and the restrictions were removed. We addressed the identified opportunity with the individual involved, to ensure appropriate handling of similar situations moving forward. We regret any frustration you experienced. '' If you refer to the CFPB complaint, you will note that I was informed ( apparently ) on XX/XX/XXXX by " XXXX '' that my accounts were closed. I learned this in a call with the Office of the CEO on XX/XX/XXXX - check the call recording. This was in the notes of the action made by " XXXX  '' when she went to cancel me. In the attached document, you'll note the credit card was opened in XXXX, after I was cancelled by " XXXX '', yet the result from the CFPB complaint was in XXXX. 

I have never used this account, did not have access to it, did not activate any cards with the account. 

I've tried to dispute this invalid credit card account via the Credit Bureaus, and so far XXXX has reported that USAA has rejected this as " open '' still. At the same time that I closed the checking/savings account, I also asked to close this " ghost '' credit card account. 

I have been rejected for new credit cards from other institutions because of this " ghost '' account showing on my record. 

My credit score has dropped XXXX points as a result of these action ( s ) by USAA and the unjust retribution actions by employee " XXXX  '', with USAA falling in line with those actions until CFPB complaint XXXX was filed and those unjust actions reversed.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: I had a mortgage with Wells Fargo Moertgage and sold the house. They sent me a check of {$800.00} to return my Escrow, and I mistakenly did a mobile deposit twice to my checking accounts : once with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and again with Wells Fargo on XX/XX/XXXX. I was in the middle of moving interstate and made that error. Both banks rejected the mobile deposit on XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) and XX/XX/XXXX ( Wells Fargo ). I then tried to deposit the actual check at a XXXX branch 2 more times ( XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX ) sharing my original mistake and both times the check was rejected by Wells Fargo so each deposit was reversed by XXXX. The XXXX branch mgr was nice enough to get me on a call with WFargo on XX/XX/XXXX where I was told by XXXX that the check had a " invisible void '' due to my deceased husband being listed on the check and to send in a fax to remove him from the account- which I did on XX/XX/XXXX. Mind you my Probate lawyer had notified WFargo of my husband 's death but they never removed him from the account. WFargo Mortgage was to reissue the Escrow Refund. Instead I receive an overnighted letter from WFargo on XX/XX/XXXX stating there would be no refund on Escrow as that check was cashed on XX/XX/XXXX ( Case # XXXX ). I have spent many hours with both WFargo Mortgage & WFChecking on the phone and they realize that the deposit was rejected by XXXX but no one can seem to issue me another Escrow refund. On XX/XX/XXXX after many frustrating hours on hold with XXXX from WFargo Mortgage, she opened up another case # : XXXX. That case was closed yesterday by XXXX stating I had deposited the check ( which I did not ). I called the number he gave me, and just got a random Escalation person, XXXX, who refused to escalate further and said I had to speak to XXXX even though she could see his email that the case was closed. XXXX was supposed to call me back and that has not happened. I have spent over 10 hours on hold trying to resolve this and just want my refund of {$800.00} and then I will move all of my funds from WFargo to XXXX where at least they respond and resolve customer issues. Wells Fargo never gives out employees last names, emails or contact phone numbers so it is impossible to resolve an issue and each person just wants to close the case as quickly as possible.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023, I paid {$5300.00} for two XXXX air conditioning condensers ( model XXXX XXXXXXXX ) using a CitiCard. At the time of the purchase I made arrangements with my installer, a regular customer of the AC seller, to pick up the units from the seller. 

After my installer went AWOL without having picked up the units from the seller, I called the seller to cancel the order and the seller agreed that they would not now release the units to the installer because the order was cancelled. However, the seller would not give me a refund ; bizarrely, the seller now claimed that the company policy was not to deal with the purchaser ( and only deal with the installer ). The seller advised me to seek redress by contacting Citi card to have the transaction voided, and my card credited. 

I made a formal request to Citi to credit my account for the merchandise that I did not receive but paid for. And I made sure to advise Citi that the merchandise still resided with the seller, as I confirmed with the seller over the phone and by email on XXXX XXXX. 

Citi responded by asking for a sales invoice as proof of purchase and/or confirmation of the lack-of-delivery/entitlement-to-a-refund. I explained to Citi that because I made a phone order, there WAS no invoice. I reminded Citi also I had indeed confirmed ( by the email that I had already shared with Citis investigator ) that the seller agreed to void the sale and hold onto the merchandise. I recommended that their investigator should simply call the seller to confirm : 1 ) that I used the Citicard for the purchase ; 2 ) that the order was canceled and ; 3 ) that my installer never picked up the units that I purchased. 

Bottom line : the seller held onto my purchase. I paid {$5300.00} that was never refunded and Citi failed in its duty sufficiently to investigate the claim on my behalf, looking to me as cardholder essentially to perform their investigation for them. Citi failed to credit my account by simply recovering the funds from the seller, AS THE SELLERS AGENT RECOMMENDED AS A SOLUTION. 

I am not now attaching documentation, since Citi has already collected that material and has it in its file.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing this dispute against TRANSUNION for unfair and inaccurate credit reporting for an unvalidated XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit Card Charge Off/Other Derogatory account with a balance of {$4200.00}. I have made several attempts to resolve the matter with All In XXXX and TRANSUNION. I have disputed this account without any action which is a violation of The Fair Credit Reporting Act. Charge Off definition based on XXXX : A charge-off is an entry on your credit report that indicates a creditor, after trying and failing to get you to make good on a debt, has given up hope of getting payment and closed your account. Per the comments reflecting on my credit report : Unpaid balance reported as a loss by credit grantor. I requested a 1099 from XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX by certified mail and did not receive a response. I am disputing inaccurate and incorrect information on the account. The account is reporting as Charge Off but does not have any payment history reporting to support delinquency on credit report therefore payments made on time, late payments, and C/O status is unknown and can not be reported as Charged off as bad debt. This is inaccurate information and I demand the charge off to be deleted immediately from my credit report. The credit bureaus keep disrespecting the laws. I showed them multiple times of how they are violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act. According to 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) the credit bureaus have to modify or delete accounts that are not reporting accurately According to 15 USC 1681b ( 1 ) the credit bureaus dont have no written permission According to 15 USC 1681 I have the right to privacy According to 15 USC 1681s-2 A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. They need to be held of violation of the consumer 's law.

Previous inquiries ( 3x last being XX/XX/XXXX ) indicated that the loan is held by the original lender yet the lawsuit ( filed XX/XX/XXXX ) reflects the owner XXXX XXXX. 

So I agreed to a stipulation under much time pressure to consent to judgment in exchange for more time to seek financing or sale of the house. That very day after consent was made, a proposed judgment amount came in and was not in line with what I envisioned. Moreover the co owner of the property came to the realization she did not retain the attorney I had used to make this deal. So I filed a XXXX XXXX to see if the bankruptcy court can help arrange a payment plan that takes into account the long and tortured history of this loan and any statue of limtations that can deduct amounts or arrange the debt to make it affordable.

I should have had an available balance of {$15.00}. However my statement shows I have a negative balance of {$56.00} and was charged {$36.00} over draft fees on the {$120.00} and the XXXX transactions even though my account should of had a balance of {$15.00}. Then on XX/XX/XXXX I had a transaction come out that was a mistake of {$17.00} I contacted the company that charged my account they immediately issued a refund for the {$17.00}. But I was still charged a {$36.00} overdraft fee. When I called the bank they made me cancel my old card but did not bother to tell me it cost {$30.00} to have a new one sent out express ( that took 6 days ). They gave me a refund for the {$30.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. Then on XX/XX/XXXX I was charged a {$36.00} overdraft fee even though there was no other transaction. Taking my total overdraft balance to {$120.00} This is my business bank account and everyday that I am unable to use it because of this is costing me a lot of money because I can not order parts for my customers pay my bills or anything that involves needing to use my bank account. I went to my local branch an the branch manager acted like she could care less and would not help fix the problem. I desperately need my account it is hard enough running a XXXX XXXX XXXX without have my account held at ransom over a mistake on there end.

Sub-issue: Fraudulent loan
Consumer complaint narrative: Commute to work has been a continuous struggle without any ventilation. Despite my requests, the company refused to accept the return of the car. I no longer desired this vehicle as it did not match my initial purchase expectations. For the past XXXX years, this car has functioned without proper air conditioning. Moreover, the car 's system frequently malfunctions while driving, causing unexpected stops in traffic. The information provided about the vehicle was deceitful and manipulative. I never agreed to pay for a car under these circumstances, and I find this manipulation highly unjust. The promise was that I would receive an operational and safe car for my family, which clearly hasn't been fulfilled. It's unfair that my family now bears this financial burden without a reliable vehicle, especially considering the needs of my XXXX child. I refuse to make payments for a car that is inoperable, as it was not part of our agreement. Despite my request, I haven't received the original contract, and the contract you attempted to provide is fraudulent and not signed by me. The Truth in Lending Act ( XXXX ), which is a federal law, mandates that lenders disclose specific information to borrowers regarding the terms and costs of the loan. This includes providing a written contract or agreement that clearly outlines the terms of the loan, such as interest rates, payment schedules, and any applicable fees. Sending a fraudulent contract is against the law. I insist on receiving the original contract before any further communication or payments. I will not make any additional payments for a car that can not be operated. XXXX years ago, returning the car was not allowed due to the representations made by your staff and the dealership, claiming no returns were possible. You manipulated me, and now you expect payment for a non-functional vehicle. The contract itself was founded on falsehoods, which is why you are withholding this information from me.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been experiencing issues with I.C. Systems regarding an alleged debt that they have been reporting on my consumer report. The debt amount is listed as {$1500.00}, and I have been disputing its validity since XXXX of 2022. Despite multiple attempts to request verification of this debt, I.C. Systems has not provided any supporting documentation to prove its validity. 

On XXXX, I sent my XXXX and final letters to XXXX XXXX I.C. Systems, requesting proof of the alleged debt and how they determined it meets the requirements for reporting. However, they have continuously disregarded my letters and have persistently reported the debt to my consumer report without providing any verification. Additionally, I successfully submitted a complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) complaint # XXXX about this unverifiable debt approximately a month ago. Logged in to the CFPB portal today to check the status but somehow my complaint can not be found. I.C. Systems has continued to report the debt XXXX more times within a two-week period. The most recent update was reported on XXXX, XXXX and XXXX I believe that I.C. Systems ' actions are in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Their failure to provide adequate verification and their continuous reporting of an unverified debt have negatively impacted my creditworthiness and caused unnecessary distress. 

I am seeking resolution in the form of a cease reporting, where I.C. Systems immediately stops reporting this unverified debt to my consumer report until they can provide adequate proof of its validity. I request that they comply with the FCRA and FDCPA regulations to ensure accurate and lawful reporting practices. If they fail to cease reporting within a reasonable time frame, I request that appropriate fines be imposed on I.C. Systems, amounting to {$1000.00} for each day the unverified debt remains on my consumer report.

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I hope for a swift resolution to address these violations. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Email : XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
My complaint is with the Pay Bill Process at Bank of America Credit Card using online or mobile app. 

My bill was due on XX/XX/2023 and I wanted to schedule the payment and amount using my checking account information. I used the mobile app which steered me to the ebill and payment process. My intension was to enter my bank routing # and acct # along with the amount and date to make payment but it appears as if Bank of America wants to force customers to schedule payment and amount but before they do so their process verifies that you have an account with the bank and that it has sufficient monies in the acct to make payment. So to verify that the account is valid, they will send 2 small deposits to my account then shortly thereafter debit my account to retrieve the monies. I have a problem with this. 

I don't like any company going into my account. If the account balance is not sufficient to cover the payment that is my problem as a customer and I should be charged whatever fees are appropriate for insufficient payment. I do not need to have Bank of America monitor my ability to manage my checking account. I believe the Bank has over stepped boundaries with customer bill paying. 

In addition, my bank account information would be stored on the screen as well as in their databases which I don't like a result of the rise in data breaches being reported. As Bank of America is not my primary bank and is just a temporary creditor, I do not want to store my bank information. 

The one-time payment option which is suppose to exist will not work unless it includes the verified bank information. So each time a one-time payment is made, the verify process will be invoked. Thus, can't make one-time payment on line or through the mobile app, because they both use the IVR process XXXX 

The one-time payment can only be made using the phone. This is not very convenient and does not work like other banks bill pay process.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2023 I was alerted by my XXXX app that an open collections had been placed on my credit report by Amsher XXXX Collections on behalf of XXXX for {$400.00}. I was alarmed because I have never done business with XXXX ever in my life. I immediately checked my credit report for other fraudulent activity, but found none. I then disputed the collections with all three of the credit bureaus, but found Amsher later supposedly verified the information, which is again false. Amsher sent me the bill from XXXX that they were basing their information on, and I found it was from and address that I haven't lived at for over 10+ years. Amsher sent me a form for identity theft and instructed me to complete it and sent to XXXX, but again they never verified that I opened the account with a SSN #, signed document, store that they were purchased at..nothing, because again it was not me. I contacted XXXX directly and created a case with them ( case # XXXX ), but have yet to hear anything back from them. I have emailed Amsher several times asking to speak to a XXXX to have this fraudulent collections removed, but have not heard anything back. After looking up online what should I do, I found that many other consumers have had the exact issues with both XXXX and Amsher Collections. When I contacted XXXX, they could not verify the XXXX # that the phones were purchased with, and there was no hit on my credit reports ( hard or soft hit ) on my credit report for XXXX. It appears that Amsher found the matching name and previous address on my credit reports and simply applied the collections to my credit report with any due diligence on their part. I am very frustrated as this has cost me both time and money to get something off my credit report that should have never been put on there in the first place.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Sub-issue: Trouble getting information about the card
Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased a prepaid gift card on XX/XX/XXXX, from XXXX, my local grocery store in the amount of {$230.00}. After registering the gift card, I was scammed. I called the toll-free number, XXXX found on the back of the card, and they explained that they could not speak to me about the card because I wasn't the owner of the card. I explained to them that I purchased the card and have the card in my possession and that's when I discovered someone in Texas was using the card. The customer service agent explained that I needed to file a claim and to submit a copy of the front and back of the actual gift card, my receipt, and a copy of my drivers license to prove that I was the owner of this card. I faxed this information to ( XXXX ) XXXX. I followed up and they informed me that I needed to wait XXXX business days to receive the fax and process this information. I have been following up every since. At first, they said the picture were too small and illegible. I resubmitted a clearer copy of the card and my id. They received it and stated I needed to provide a larger copy of my id. I have faxed it over 4 times and continue to follow up. I feel as if they're giving me the run around now. I faxed the requested information on XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and the issue is still not resolved.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to inquire about a possible resolution to the issue I am facing with the wire transfer scam investigation ( XXXX XXXX # : XXXX, scammer 's Citi account XXXX XXXX ). Recently, I fell victim to a wire transfer scam when I wired {$9400.00} from XXXX to Citibank to purchase a watch as a wedding gift from my wife to me. Unfortunately, the seller never sent the watch and disappeared. To confirm that it was a scam, I conducted an email test from a different account. Since then, I have filed an XXXX report, a police report ( XXXX from XXXX, XXXX ), and an FTC report XXXX XXXX ) regarding this incident. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I made the wire transfer and realized it was a scam. I promptly filed a claim with the XXXX claims department and initiated a recall on XX/XX/XXXX. Since then, Citibank has requested a police report and a hold harmless letter. XXXX provided both the police report ( XX/XX/XXXX ) as well as the hold harmless letter to Citibank ( sent via physical mail on XX/XX/XXXX and via fax on XX/XX/XXXX ). However, Citibank is unable to process a recall as they are unable to contact the beneficiary to return the funds and advised me to contact the beneficiary directly to resolve this matter. I am unsure how I can contact the scammer to recover the funds. 

Even with the cooperation of authorities like the police department and FBI, the inconsistent responses and lack of support from Citibank have added to my frustration and distress. I understand that I made a mistake, as many people do at some point in their lives, and I take responsibility for it. However, I was trying to save as much money as possible, as those funds were intended for our wedding gift. This situation has left me deeply devastated. I have always believed that a reputable bank like Citibank would stand by its customers, not the scammers. I had hoped for assistance in recovering the funds from the scammer 's bank. I implore you to please offer any help in resolving this case and recovering the funds. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint involves two banks : First National Bank of Omaha and XXXX XXXX  XXXX We opened account with XXXX in XXXX We requested balance transfer We were not granted the amount requested and the pop up said we would be notified if they were able to do a transfer We received the card late XXXX We signed up for online services and upon doing so saw a transfer pending - although we were unsure to where Later we saw that the transfer was complete but did not see it on any account we had Contacted XXXX  XXXX XXXX numerous times and have been in contact with and discussed with 5 Executive advocates that each tell us that we need to resolve this issue with FNBO because they cashed the check. Its my understanding that XXXX has contacted FNBO and they are saying that can't speak with them about the issue or use the Miss applied balance info that has been sent because they are not the customer and that my husband and I will have to do this. They have also completed a dispute for us just yesterday after two months of requesting help after a manager at XXXX and FNBO spoke and disagreed on the next steps. We have been told in no uncertain terms that XXXX can do nothing else for us. Listen to all the recorded calls please. 

Contacted FNBO as requested by XXXX. We usually can not get farther than the associate- although lately, we have been able to get a manager to discuss. FNBO says that it is XXXX that needs to resolve this. I have sent a copy of the cashed check to FNBO 4 times to the accounting department. Apparently, because the check has not been applied to an account it is in limbo. So they say it is XXXX  that we need to talk to. 

The check for balance transfer had many issues. The account number was incorrect XXXX has made it clear that we must have made that mistake - Ok maybe we did it is our XXXX XXXX XXXX number except one number is incorrect. The check was sent to XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX and cashed by First National Bank of Omaha. The check was for {$470.00} and was written on XX/XX/23 and per my statement cashed XX/XX/23. Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2022 I noticed a charge on my Wells Fargo credit card of {$490.00}. I called the number listed on the charge and was told it was for an internet protection which I did not purchase. 
I was told that to remove the charge I would have to enter two amounts of {$250.00} and the charge would be deleted. Unknown to me, they had control of my computer and they entered the amount of {$25000.00}. So it appeared on my screen that I had deposited {$25000.00} into my checking account. In order to remove that money I had to send two wire transfers totaling {$25000.00} to an account in XXXX. 
So I went to the bank and had those wire transfers completed. I did NOT instruct the teller to charge my two credit card accounts. I wanted the money taken from my checking account. 
Of course there was no {$25000.00} in my checking account. 
So, without my consent, or even my knowledge, my two credit cards were charged {$25000.00} If the banker had asked me where to get where to get the funds, it would have been apparent it was a scam, but SHE DID NOT ASK. She arbitrarily and without my permission, charged my two accounts. 
By the time I realized it was a scam, the transfers were already made. I feel I was defrauded twice : once by the scammers and once by the bank. 
I have spoken with the bank on several occasions and have sent a dispute letter. And have filed a police report. 
Wells Fargo has determined there was no fraud.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
As a consumer, I have encountered inaccurate and misleading information on my credit reports, which has resulted in significant harm to my financial well-being. I believe that these credit reporting agencies have violated the provisions outlined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) under 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ).

The specific violation involves the failure of credit reporting agencies to provide accurate and complete information about my credit history, resulting in the misrepresentation of my creditworthiness to potential lenders, employers, and other entities that rely on credit reports for decision-making purposes. I have diligently monitored my credit reports and found multiple instances where outdated, incorrect, or unverified information has been reported, thereby undermining my ability to access credit and obtain favorable terms. 

According to 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ), credit reporting agencies are required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information contained in consumer reports. Furthermore, they must conduct a reasonable investigation within 30 days of receiving a dispute regarding the accuracy of any information on a consumer 's credit report. However, the credit reporting agencies in question have failed to fulfill these obligations, thereby violating my rights as a consumer. 

I have made multiple attempts to dispute and rectify these inaccuracies directly with the credit reporting agencies. However, their responses have been unsatisfactory, often providing generic and unhelpful explanations without conducting thorough investigations or taking appropriate corrective actions. These actions not only harm my financial reputation but also undermine the integrity and reliability of the credit reporting system. 

Considering these circumstances, I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate actions against the credit reporting agencies involved. I believe that enforcement actions, penalties, and the implementation of stringent compliance measures are necessary to ensure that credit reporting agencies comply with the requirements of 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) and safeguard the rights of consumers.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have this loan for approximately 7 years and pay on an auto payment that is {$70.00} higher than the amount due. The property is two units on one lot or parcel number. In mid XX/XX/2023 I received an auto dialer call asking me to call LoanCare. I called and the lady I eventualy got on the phone explained my payment was short due to an increase {$300.00} per month in the cost of insurance. I explained that was incorrect and we got the insurance department on the phone. It turns out they misread my policy and didnt realize my insurance covered both units and so they added lender paid insurance for one unit at a cost of {$3000.00} a year and thats what raised my payment. They said to not worry about it and they would fix it asap. 
I followed up at the end of XXXX and was told they were working on it still. 
On XX/XX/XXXX the credit bureau notified me my credit has dropped XXXX points due to a 30 day late to LoanCare. I instantly called them and was eventually hung on during a transfer. This happened 3 times on Monday XX/XX/XXXX. Each call was close to 45 minutes before the supposed transfer to an escalator or supervisor. On Tuesday XX/XX/XXXX I called 3 more times before finally reaching an " escalation '' person as there are no supervisors. She was nice and we spent close to 90 minutes going through everything. She said the lender paid insurance was removed but my payment was still {$300.00} higher per month but couldnt explain why. She did say my actual insurance was paid twice this year but at a cost of {$800.00} per year it wouldnt have increased my payment that much. She recommneded I pay the difference and she would email me an escrow breakdown. I never received any email. I asked to speak with someone to help with the mark on my credit, she explained that department does not use phones apparently and told me to fax them. I have sent that fax twice with no response or change. 
On Friday XX/XX/XXXX I missed a call from the insurance department at Loancare. I called back and it took me 3 tries again and over 2 hours to get a person on the phone. She didnt understand my insurance policy somehow and was asking me questions about it but couldnt seem to grasp the concept of 2 units on one loan. I asked my insurance company to reach out as well and theyve had a similar experience. 
In summary I would really appreciate someone not working from home with kids screaming in background and dogs barking to please call me and help get this impound account corrected, and correct the late on my credit. 
Thank you XXXX XXXX XXXX

I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, there were two charges made on my credit card via XXXX XXXX that I did not make or authorize. I was traveling to XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX XXXX where I live, which is where the charges were made. I received an automated text message from Wells Fargo on XX/XX/XXXX with whom I bank and have my credit card through alerting me to possible fraud. I acknowledged the text message with a " Y '' and called Wells Fargo on XX/XX/XXXX when I saw that the two charges were on my credit card statement and noticed that I no longer had my credit card and that it had been compromised. On XX/XX/XXXX Wells Fargo canceled my credit card, credited the balance to my account, and sent me a new credit card. In XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed that the fraud charges were placed back on my account. I called Wells Fargo and they told me that they found the charges to be valid because I authorized the charges when I responded to their automated text on XX/XX/XXXX with a " Y ''. I explained to them that I did not realize I was authorizing any charges, and that I was acknowledging their message. I asked to have the claim reopened and that I could submit documentation showing that the credit card used to make those charges was never associated or linked to an XXXX XXXX account. I submitted the documentation via mail after multiple failed attempts from my local Wells Fargo branch to fax the documentation with the fax numbers provided. Wells Fargo again denied my claim despite me showing that I did not have an XXXX XXXX account. They were never able to identify or get in touch with the two merchants to whom the charges were made. The two charges were : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA for {$450.00} and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA for {$85.00}. Wells Fargo told me that because I have other charges from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA that I must have known the first merchant. I explained to them that XXXX XXXX  is a local coffee shop here in XXXX XXXX XXXX, and that they do not have a location outside of XXXX XXXX XXXX and that it is not the same as the merchant that {$450.00} went to. I have asked Wells Fargo to reopen the case three times and each time they denied it for the same reason. I am not responsible for both of the charges that I did not make despite me never having had an XXXX XXXX account linked to the compromised card, AND my card not being in my possession at the time. Thank you.

You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation, OR COPIES FOR THAT MATTER, as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified.

Sections 616 and 617 provide me with remedy when a credit reporting agency does not comply with the law. You are willful noncomplying with the FCRA.

Since you CLAIM TO HAVE VERIFIED THIS ACCOUNT BUT HAVE NOT PROVIDED ME WITH ANY INFORMATION. I WILL GIVE YOU ONE LAST CHANCE TO UPDATE '' THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNT. 
Please update the following account, or inaccurate information, from my file immediately & send me the results to the address listed XXXX XXXXXXXX

I am seeking to get this charge removed from my account, that finance charges related to the disputed amount be credited to my account be removed, and that I get an accurate statement. 

I have contacted Citibank on several occasions to get this issue resolved : On XX/XX/2023, I talked to XXXX Citibank Member Services, and the customer service representative reversed a previous credit without my permission. 
On XX/XX/2023, I talked to XXXX in customer service, and he requested on audit on this charge. 
On XX/XX/2023, I talked to XXXX and was told to wait XXXX business days, and I would see a credit on my account. That did not happen. 
On XX/XX/2023, I talked to XXXX and XXXX. XXXX told me to expect to see a credit on my account by XX/XX/2023. 
On XX/XX/2023, I received a letter from Citibank indicating they had permanently closed the dispute, and I had no further recourse. 

Enclosed are copies of the audit conducted by the dispute department at Citibank, veriyfing my claim that I had been charged twice for the item. The total balance should be {$2100.00}, not {$4200.00}. Citibank has yet to give me credit for the {$2100.00} due me. Interest is accruing on this item. My account is current on other items. 

Please do whatever is necessary to correct this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative: During XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2023 I was on a retreat with my girlfriend and camping outside of XXXX XXXX Tx XXXX I left all of my personal belongings in my truck parked outside of my apartment building. When I returned, I was missing my phone and my wallet unfortunately. As I got a new phone, I was alerted that there had been tons of alerts from Wells Fargo, my bank. Emails and text messages regarding suspicious activity I had missed through the days. When I got into my online banking I was prompted to change my login information. I then saw that over {$4500.00} worth of charges had been made from the XXXX, Texas area to Colorado. Some of them including XXXX, which is illegal in Texas. I filed my claim the same night I returned home and waited to hear back. This morning on XX/XX/2023 I was informed that it was denied. They claim that the patterns are not consistent with what they are looking for. They are also claiming that the headquarters of the merchants XXXX be reported on the transactions and that the transactions were made in Texas. They also claim that since my PIN was used there is no chance it was anyone but me. Half of the transactions were made using my XXXX XXXX and online banking however. I just started a new job and lost my a majority of my {$5000.00} signing bonus. I was going to have a police report and they said I never provided it, but they said someone would reach out and ask for it. That request was never made from me and I didn't have a chance to even submit it. Per the process I will file it and provide it to anyone neccessary. I am asking for help as they are denying my chance to appeal the claim. The person I spoke with last told me to dispute it with fanduel and others, but I don't have any kind of information on these merchants or accounts created using my banking information.

Product: Checking or savings account
Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX checking account was hacked into on XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, at approximately, XXXXXXXX XXXX. The XXXX did a wire transfer to XXXX without my authorization. 
I was able to detect it fast as I was online in the process of doing a XXXX transfer. I had previous done XXXX XXXX successfully but on this occasion I forgot to tick the box to continue. It took me forty-minutes to figure out that I had forget to remember to to tick the box to say its not a scam to proceed and click continue. I hardly ever send by XXXX but do receive XXXX from my clients. 
Seem I wasnt successful with sending XXXX so I logged out of my account and back in within in 5 minutes I noticed {$8.00}, XXXX was taken out of my account. 
It happened with the 5 plus minutes I had logged out and back in. As a result I called Wells Fargo immediately. 
I noticed the scammed wire Transfer was pending so asked in panic while on the phone to a representative to stop the unauthorized transfer as it perhaps wasnt complete if it was pending. 
I did not authorize this transaction. 
I was directed 5 times to finally a representative to plead my case and stop further unauthorized fraud that could take place. Finally they registered my fraud claim. I asked to credit to my account but presently it has not happened as I needed money to pay bills. 
During my own investigation I noticed the Hacker created the name, XXXX XXXX as a new XXXX recipient with an email address of XXXX. But he did not do a XXXX transaction. I do not know this person at all. 
The wire transfer went to a XXXX in XXXX. Looking at the wire transfer - that he filled out pretending to me, he first had to fill all fields in including his own bank details which his account ended in XXXX. 
When asked in the field what the money was for- he said it was for Travel expenses. 
One must understand, I had no intensions of going to XXXX, I do not have or never had any flight booking or hotels paid for. Doesnt make sense to send money to someone to pay for my flight hotels and expenses etc, I can do that myself which is obvious. 
If i had it made booking it would have shown up in my Wells Fargo account. 
Its also worth mentioning that in the past wire transfers I did to XXXX which were many going back yrs- were successful and had no issues. 
The bank charged me a wire transfer fees to XXXX for goods and services. With the scammed wire transfer - no fee by the bank was charged which is weird as banks always charge a wire transfer fee. 
I also never received or had seen a text message on my phone to to authorize and or reject such transaction. If i had, i would have immediately rejected it as fraud. 
I herby state that the above information is correct to my recollection and ability. I did not authorize this transaction. I do not know anyone in XXXX. Nor am to receive any goods or services from such a person. 
My account was hacked into and I cant tell you how as I do not have the comprehension the DNA to know how it is achieved. 
As a result i would like Well Fargo Bank to reinstate the full amount of {$8500.00} asap so that I can continue to pay bills and have peace of mind.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Mortgage Escrow department refuses to apply reductions in projected property tax obligations. They are basing escrow on tax status of previous owner. They are knowingly retaining excessive portion of my mortgage payment without interest. 
I have attempted since XX/XX/XXXX to get their Tax department to correct their errors without success. Copies of all changes affecting the reduction of my property taxes was forwarded to the Escrow department and it is recorded with XXXX XXXX XXXX department that on XX/XX/XXXX they accessed and verified the changes. 

Assessed value of the property was reduced from {$540000.00} in XXXX to {$390000.00} in XXXX. The reduction in assessed value lowered property from {$4700.00} in XXXX to {$3400.00} in XXXX. 

Ownership of the property changed in XX/XX/XXXX. I am a XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Veteran. The approved annual deduction is {$1500.00}. {$750.00} reduction in tax obligation applied to XX/XX/XXXX payment and {$750.00} applied to XX/XX/XXXX. 

The result of the two reductions has lowered property tax from {$4700.00} in XXXX to {$1900.00} in XXXX. A major reduction!!!! The escrow payment for taxes is reduced from $ XXXX in XXXX to {$150.00} in XXXX. A $ XXXX mo reduction in escrow withholding. The Escrow department added a {$50.00}. / mo deficiency withholding, giving a total excess of {$280.00} being withheld each month for 12 months. 

The correct calculation of Escrow payment ; Taxes $ XXXX = {$150.00} Insurance $ XXXX = {$100.00} Escrow Payment {$250.00} The {$280.00} / mo withheld by the mortgage without interest should be applied to my principal, reducing my interest charges and elimination of my debt. The knowingly misappropriating my funds should be considered a criminal act. It is on record that the Tax department was made aware of these reductions on XXXX XXXX but disregard the reductions for their financial gain. 

The Escrow withholding is a projected figure based on property owners expected expenses and reductions, not an exact figure based on past ownership and tax status.

Also be advised that I am keeping very accurate records of all correspondence from you and your company.

I have disputed this debt ; therefore, until validated you know your information concerning this debt is inaccurate. Thus, if you have already reported this debt to any credit-reporting agency ( CRA ) or Credit Bureau ( CB ) then, you must immediately inform them of my dispute with this debt. Reporting information that you know to be inaccurate or failing to report information correctly violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act 1681s-2. Should you pursue a judgement without validating this debt, I will inform the judge and request the case be dismissed based on your failure to comply with the FDCPA.

Finally, if you do not own this debt, I demand that you immediately send a copy of this dispute letter to the original creditor so they are also aware of my dispute with this debt.
