Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Lender trying to repossess or disable the vehicle
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Notice of Dispute - Repossession of Vehicle under SCRA and Request for Remedies Dear Hyundai Motors Finance, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to dispute the repossession of my vehicle, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, which occurred on XX/XX/XXXX. As the spouse of an active service member, I believe that my rights under the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act ( SCRA ) have been violated in this instance. 

Pursuant to Section 3952 of the SCRA, I have the right to be protected from repossession without a court order if I meet the following criteria : 1. I purchased/leased the aforementioned vehicle prior to entering XXXX XXXX XXXX 
2. I made a deposit or installment payment on the vehicle prior to entering XXXX XXXX service. 

Based on the abovementioned criteria, I am confident that I am entitled to the protections provided by the SCRA, and the repossession of my vehicle without a court order is a direct violation of my rights. 

I kindly request that you take immediate action to rectify this matter by : 1. Ceasing any further attempts to collect the debt associated with the repossession of my vehicle. 
2. Returning my vehicle to me, free of any damages or charges incurred due to the repossession. 
3. Correcting any negative reporting on my credit file regarding this repossession incident. 
4. Refunding any fees or costs associated with the repossession and subsequent legal proceedings. 

I expect a prompt response to this letter, acknowledging your receipt and acceptance of my dispute, within XXXX days from the date of this letter. It is imperative that you provide a formal written response detailing your proposed resolution or any additional information required to proceed with this dispute. 

Failure to comply with the SCRA and address this issue in a timely manner will leave me with no choice but to explore all available legal remedies to enforce my rights, including but not limited to pursuing a lawsuit for violations of the SCRA. 

I have enclosed copies of relevant documentation, including proof of marriage to the XXXX XXXX XXXX the vehicle purchase/lease agreement, and evidence of payments made prior to entering XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, to support my claim. Please review these documents carefully before formulating your response. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I trust that you will promptly resolve this dispute in accordance with the rules and regulations set forth by the SCRA. I request that all future communications regarding this issue be in writing and sent via certified mail to ensure proper documentation. 

Yours sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX.

( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Subject : XXXXXXXX XXXX Erroneous Reporting and FCRA Violations Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to bring a grave matter to your attention regarding the credit reporting practices of XXXX, a creditor with whom I have had an account. Despite notifying XXXX twice through each credit bureau about the erroneous information they have reported on my credit file, they have continuously failed to rectify the issue. 

Exhibit A : FCRA Violations by XXXX Violation 1 : Failure to Provide Disclosures XXXX did not provide any disclosures before reporting my credit information, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 609 ( a ) ( 2 ). Potential statutory damages for this violation amount to {$100.00} to {$1000.00}.

Violation 2 : Lack of Opt-Out Options XXXX neglected to provide me with any opt-out options, contravening FCRA, Section 609 ( e ). Potential statutory damages for this violation amount to {$100.00} to {$1000.00}.

Violation 3 : Absence of Privacy Disclosures XXXX failed to furnish any privacy disclosures as mandated by FCRA, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ). Potential statutory damages for this violation amount to {$100.00} to {$1000.00}.

Violation 4 : Inaccurate Reporting XXXX continued to report erroneous information despite being informed of the inaccuracies twice, violating FCRA, Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Potential actual damages for this violation may include any losses I suffered due to their inaccurate reporting.

Violation 5 : Lack of Data Redundancy XXXX reported conflicting information to each credit bureau, displaying a lack of data redundancy and accurate record-keeping, violating FCRA, Section 607 ( b ). Potential actual damages for this violation may include any losses I incurred due to their poor record-keeping.

Exhibit B : Potential Monetary Awards Violation 1 : Failure to Provide Disclosures - {$1000.00} Violation 2 : Lack of Opt-Out Options - {$1000.00} Violation 3 : Absence of Privacy Disclosures - {$1000.00} Violation 4 : Inaccurate Reporting - Actual damages to be determined in court Violation 5 : Lack of Data Redundancy - Actual damages to be determined in court Potential Total Monetary Award in Court : {$3000.00} ( statutory damages ) + Actual damages for Violation 4 + Actual damages for Violation 5 I believe that XXXXXXXX XXXX continuous disregard for FCRA regulations has caused significant damage to my financial standing and well-being upwards of {$10000.00}. Despite giving them ample time to rectify their errors, they persist with frivolous furnishings, leading me to seek justice through legal action. 

I kindly request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to intervene in this matter and hold XXXX responsible for their actions. Your intervention is essential in upholding consumer rights and ensuring fair and accurate credit reporting practices. 

Thank you for your attention to this critical issue. I trust that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will take appropriate action to remedy this situation and protect the interests of consumers like myself. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023, I filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau against Barclays for their failure to comply with XXXX guidelines in investigating my quality of goods and service dispute for a purchase with XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/2023, Barclays responded to my complaint and acknowledged that I provided the necessary documentation for the dispute and initiated a chargeback. While Barclays acknowledged my timely submission and the appropriate documentation on XX/XX/2023, they sent conflicting correspondences dated XX/XX/2023. One letter falsely claimed that I withdrew my dispute, while the other letter stated that the merchant did not violate the terms and conditions of the sale agreement and that their cancellation/refund policy was not followed. 

I want to emphasize that the core of my dispute lies in the fact that the roller shades I received from XXXX XXXX were severely damaged, defective, incorrect, and completely nonfunctional. It is only reasonable to expect that I would not be expected to keep items that exhibit such serious flaws. Despite providing all the necessary information to support my claim, Barclays failed to conduct a comprehensive review and neglected their obligation to credit my account in accordance with the guidelines set by XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX XXXX XXXX a delinquent/late payment was reported to the credit bureaus. I had made a payment plan with XXXX XXXX prior to that and had followed it accordingly. When they reported my payment late, I called and spoke to the general manager XXXX XXXX ( he was also the one who helped me set up the payment plan ). He admitted it was a mistake on their end and it should have never been reported. I asked him to resolve it and he was very flighty, it took me 4 times of asking him until he said he would need to submit something to the credit department but it would take a long time. I said that was fine. Since he kept complaining about it I asked for the credit departments contact information and he said they dont give it out to customers and only he can do it. After 2 months I reached out to XXXX because it was still on my credit report and he said oh I assumed they fixed it because I didnt hear anything and said nothing else can be done. So I filed a claim with each bureau explaining this and all were denied except one. I resubmitted and they were still denied. XXXX said they couldnt do anything about it even though I reminded them they admitted it was their mistake. I asked for a Corporate phone number and they said they didnt have one. I then began working with a credit repair agency and they said this sounded shady, and have been working on removing this from my credit report at the other 2 bureaus but they have been unsuccessful. So it is still on my credit report even though XXXX admitted it was their mistake. 
Aside from this major issue, XXXX has been EXTREMELY rude and insulting in every interaction I have ever had with him. They have also called over XXXX times in XXXX day for days on end. I have just paid off this entire loan so my account is closed with them but I am still not okay with their shady business practices.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023 I contacted Truist Customer Service with regards to a promotional offer I received in mail and email. The promotion offered a {$400.00} bonus for opening a new checking account. The requirements were 1 ) open a new Truist One Checking account, and 2 ) complete at least two qualifying direct deposits, totaling {$1000.00} or more and be made within 90 days of account opening. After confirming my eligibility I went ahead and opened a Truist checking account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Truist Customer Service to ask why I hadn't received the bonus. The customer representative told me that I was eligible and I should have received the bonus. After an hour ( ONE HOUR ) on the phone, the representative told me that I hadn't met criteria # 2. However, my records ( Truist banking statements ) show the following direct deposits : XX/XX/2023 {$1000.00} XX/XX/2023 {$1000.00} XX/XX/2023 {$1000.00} XX/XX/2023 {$1000.00} XX/XX/2023 {$1000.00} XX/XX/2023 {$1000.00} XX/XX/2023 {$1000.00} XX/XX/2023 {$1000.00} After ANOTHER HOUR the representative told that I wasn't qualified because I had another Truist One Checking account. The representative told me they couldn't find the account, and by the way it doesn't appear on my banking statements, doesn't appear to my online portal, and frankly doesn't exist. 

In addition, my account was charged {$3.00} the past four months. And since the account earns no interest, every time I transferred to another bank, they will charge me another {$3.00} fee. 

How remarkably terrible customer experience and poor service.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a Barclays credit card account for a Frontier Airlines card. I checked my credit score on XXXX XXXX about a month ago ( XX/XX/2023 ), and saw that my score went down as there was a new line of credit opened. As I investigated further, I saw that there was {$970.00} in charges to this newly opened Barclays Banana Republic credit card account. I was very confused as I know I only have one Barclays account and I have never shopped at Banana Republic. I immediately called Barclays ( XX/XX/2023 ), reported it as fraud, had an investigation opened and the account closed. I also made an account on IdentityTheft.gov and went through their " Recovery Plan '' which suggested I place a credit freeze and fraud alert on my credit reports as well as an extended fraud alert, which I did.

Today ( XX/XX/2023 ) I checked my credit score again and the {$970.00} in charges were back on my report and the remark on my account now stated " Account previously in dispute - Now resolved by data furnisher ''. Again, I immediately called the Barclays fraud department. They said that their investigation determined it couldn't be fraud as you have to present an ID to get the Banana Republic card. I demanded my account be re-investigated for fraud and told them I will be sending a letter of explanation as well as submitting a complaint to CFPB.
